urls.title: Duration of Antibody Responses after Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome
urls.description: Among 176 patients who had had severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), SARS-specific antibodies were maintained for an average of 2 years, and significant reduction of immunoglobulin G–positive percentage and titers occurred in the third year. ...

text:
@mdnij34 For all of those mentioning vaccines...

Keep in mind it's not be for life.
The antibody lifespan for SARS & MERS is like 2 years with a sharp drop off during year 3.
I have heard suggestions that COVID19 could be much less than this (6-9 months).

https://t.co/FIhhRvhgHS

entity.name: COVID-19: Latest news updates from around the world
entity.description: This page is a timeline of Tweets with the latest information and updates on COVID-19 from experts, journalists, health authorities and other trusted sources from around the world. For more on COVID-19, visit: twitter.com/explore/tabs/covid-19
